DataFeatures.Name: Manufacturer
DataFeatures.Definition: The company or entity that produced the article or product.
DataFeatures.SourceDescription: The manufacturer name is mentioned in the input text.

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Manufacturer name
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: legally valid designation of the natural or judicial person which is directly responsible for the design, production, packaging and labeling of a product in respect to its being brought into circulation

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Designation of manufacturer
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: The specifying designation (company name) for the product manufacturer/ publishers (card, book, other publication or CD)

SimilarAnnotations.Name: product designation of manufacturer
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: designation used by the manufacturer for his product

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Manufacturer product designation
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: Short description of the product (short text)

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Manufacturer's name for complete product
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: Natural or judicial person which is directly responsible for the design, production (and packaging) of a complete product or entire system in respect to its being brought into circulation, whereby this person is responsible independently of whether these activities were carried out by this person or by third parties on its behalf

DataFeatures.Name: Manufacturer code
DataFeatures.Definition: A unique code assigned by the manufacturer to identify the specific product.
DataFeatures.SourceDescription: The manufacturer code is mentioned in the input text.

SimilarAnnotations.Name: model code of manufacturer
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: sequence of characters assigned in accordance with certain rules of the manufacturer's for designation of the model

SimilarAnnotations.Name: product code
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: machine-readable string of the model of the machine, that might include options like the hardware configuration of the model

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Code of the manufacturer declaration
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: Code of the manufacturer explanations or notes for a component or device in text form

SimilarAnnotations.Name: order code of manufacturer
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: by manufactures issued unique combination of numbers and letters used to identify the device for ordering

SimilarAnnotations.Name: identification code on the product
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: a series of characters according to specific rules that are used for describing (also part of) a sentence

DataFeatures.Name: Part number
DataFeatures.Definition: A unique number assigned to a specific part or component of the product.
DataFeatures.SourceDescription: The part number is mentioned in the input text.

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Manufacturing part number
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: Sequence of characters for identifying name of a manufacturing part

SimilarAnnotations.Name: number of the parts list
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: Description of the list that includes all individual parts required for manufacturing or assembling a product

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Spare parts lists - numbers
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: Reference to a document in which the part to be procured is described in greater detail and/or represented graphically

SimilarAnnotations.Name: number of parts
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: describes the number of the parts of the object

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Product number
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: Coded series of characters which is used in place of the article (or service) by a body supplying administrative services and is thus the meaningful unit, for example, in planning and control systems or warehousing

DataFeatures.Name: Valve function
DataFeatures.Definition: The function or operation of the valve.
DataFeatures.SourceDescription: The valve function is mentioned in the input text.

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Material of valve
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: material (fabric, raw material) the valve is made of (having regard to its outward form and/or the process of formation resp. of manufacture)

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Material description of the valve body
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: usual name or brand name of the material in everyday language, of the valve body

SimilarAnnotations.Name: valve protection function present
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: specification whether the is a valve protection function

SimilarAnnotations.Name: valve seat velocity
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: mean velocity of the flow through the valve seat at the specified operating conditions

SimilarAnnotations.Name: valve lock
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: indication of whether the lock has a valve function which closes its lumen as a passage barrier when not in use

DataFeatures.Name: Type of actuation
DataFeatures.Definition: The method or mechanism used to activate or control the valve.
DataFeatures.SourceDescription: The type of actuation is mentioned in the input text.

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Actuation type
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: means of moving a fluidic valve from its normal position to its operating position or vice versa by means of external force

SimilarAnnotations.Name: type of control
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: method of transmitting the actuation signal to the shifting element of a directional control valve

SimilarAnnotations.Name: type of valve activation
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: method of activating the fitting

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Actuation
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: Mechanical type of motion of a control or switch

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Type of actuation
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: Type of voltage with which the shunt release can be operated

DataFeatures.Name: Valve size
DataFeatures.Definition: The size or dimensions of the valve.
DataFeatures.SourceDescription: The valve size is mentioned in the input text.

SimilarAnnotations.Name: nominal width (DN)
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: diameter of a pipe/hose or the size/mounting dimension of a valve

SimilarAnnotations.Name: flap size
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: information on the size of the heart valve

SimilarAnnotations.Name: wrench size
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: describes the size of the wrench

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Product size (cavity 2)
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: the size of the appliance for second cavity described as small, medium or large depending on its volume determined by a standard procedure (energy label classification)

SimilarAnnotations.Name: face-to face length of valve
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: indicated distance between the - to the centre line - horizontal, external surfaces of the housing end apertures

DataFeatures.Name: Standard nominal flow rate
DataFeatures.Definition: The standard or expected flow rate of the valve.
DataFeatures.SourceDescription: The standard nominal flow rate is mentioned in the input text.

SimilarAnnotations.Name: nominal volume flow rate
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: describes the nominal volume flow rate

SimilarAnnotations.Name: nominal supply flow rate
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: specification of a flow rate, which is generated by a power supply, which describes for a component or system that it belongs to a certain classification (hydraulics)

SimilarAnnotations.Name: nominal flow rate
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: volume flow of the gasses, those removed from the gaseous phase from a vacuum vessel by the vacuum pump under nominal conditions

SimilarAnnotations.Name: nominal total flow rate
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: specification of a flow rate, consisting of the pilot flow rate, internal leakage and outlet flow rate, which describes for a component or system that it belongs to a certain classification (hydraulics)

SimilarAnnotations.Name: nominal flow rate
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: specification of a flow rate, which describes for a component or system that it belongs to a certain classification (hydraulics)

DataFeatures.Name: Operating pressure
DataFeatures.Definition: The range of pressure in which the valve can operate.
DataFeatures.SourceDescription: The operating pressure is mentioned in the input text.

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Operating pressure
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: The pressure which arises in a system part within the operating range

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Greatest value of operating pressure range
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: States the highest value of pressure with which a device can be operated

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Nominal operation pressure of the compressed air
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: The pressure occurring within the operating range in a system section. Note: Depending on where it is used, the term operating pressure means both the thermodynamic instantaneous value (absolute pressure) and the operating overpressure as the basis for the firmness-based component calculation (see DIN 1314).

SimilarAnnotations.Name: maximum operating pressure
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: upper limit of the pressure range at which a fluidic device fulfils its function

SimilarAnnotations.Name: minimum operating pressure
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: lower limit of the pressure range at which a fluidic device fulfils its function

DataFeatures.Name: Design structure
DataFeatures.Definition: The structure or design of the valve.
DataFeatures.SourceDescription: The design structure is mentioned in the input text.

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Design of ventilation
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: Defined brand or make of ventilation as a variant which clearly distinguishes it from the other objects within a group of similar or related objects through at least one attribute

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Material description of the valve body
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: usual name or brand name of the material in everyday language, of the valve body

SimilarAnnotations.Name: design
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: certain design in the context of a type which is generally distinguished by the construction or the dimensions

SimilarAnnotations.Name: design
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: certain design in the context of a type which is generally distinguished by the construction or the dimensions

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Construction form of the seal surface, connection, gas feedback
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: a specific design within the context of a type, which is generally characterized by its dimensions. A construction can comprise several design (variants), which generally vary in terms of mechanical details

DataFeatures.Name: Type of reset
DataFeatures.Definition: The method or mechanism used to reset the valve.
DataFeatures.SourceDescription: The type of reset is mentioned in the input text.

SimilarAnnotations.Name: type of valve activation
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: method of activating the fitting

SimilarAnnotations.Name: valve return
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: constructional design of the mechanism that moves the valve piston into the de-energised position

SimilarAnnotations.Name: reset function present
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: specification whether the device is equipped with the reset function

SimilarAnnotations.Name: reset function
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: specifies whether the operating device is equipped with a reset function

SimilarAnnotations.Name: shut-off valve function
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: method of interrupting the flow of the fluidic medium

DataFeatures.Name: Protection class
DataFeatures.Definition: The level of protection against external factors such as dust and water.
DataFeatures.SourceDescription: The protection class is mentioned in the input text.

SimilarAnnotations.Name: protection class
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: indication of the safety class of the object

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Protection class (IP, rear side)
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: Numerical classification and designation system in accordance with International Electrotechnical Commission 60529 for the indication of degrees of protection, preceded by the symbol IP, for use in empty housings or housings of electrical equipment in order to protect persons against contact with live or moving parts (except smooth shafts or Similar parts) in the interior of the housing to ensure the protection of the (electrical) working medium against the penetration of solid foreign bodies or dust and, where specified by the classification, the protection of the electrical equipment against harmful ingress of vapors, moisture or water / Location specific: the return / return page

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Class of Ex- protection
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: Class of Ex-protection

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Protection class in accordance with EN 60 730-1
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: The - for a device or component - prescribed protection class in accordance with EN 60 730-1

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Index of protection class
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: Supplementary index of the protection calss which contains the information necessary to achieve the specified degree of protection of the product

DataFeatures.Name: Nominal size
DataFeatures.Definition: The nominal size of the valve.
DataFeatures.SourceDescription: The nominal size is mentioned in the input text.

SimilarAnnotations.Name: nominal width (DN)
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: diameter of a pipe/hose or the size/mounting dimension of a valve

SimilarAnnotations.Name: nominal size (Outlet)
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: alphanumeric description of the size of components in a pipe system as a reference, in contrast to components that are defined by an outer diameter or by a thread size

SimilarAnnotations.Name: nominal size
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: alphanumeric description of the size of components in a pipe system as a reference, in contrast to components that are defined by an outer diameter or by a thread size

SimilarAnnotations.Name: nominal size at location 2
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: alphanumeric description of the size of components in a pipe system as a reference, in contrast to components that are defined by an outer diameter or by a thread size

SimilarAnnotations.Name: nominal size (Inlet)
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: alphanumeric description of the size of components in a pipe system as a reference, in contrast to components that are defined by an outer diameter or by a thread size

DataFeatures.Name: Switching time off
DataFeatures.Definition: The time it takes for the valve to switch off.
DataFeatures.SourceDescription: The switching time off is mentioned in the input text.

SimilarAnnotations.Name: shifting off-time
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: length of time that elapses between the control signal (electric or pneumatic) being withdrawn and the pressure decreasing at the respective valve output until 90 % of the defined operating pressure is reached

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Valve switching times from 0 to 1
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: Time between the switch-on command and the control of a component which controls or regulates the direction, the pressure or volume flow of a fluid

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Valve switching times from 0 to 1
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: Time between the switch-on command and the control of a component which controls or regulates the direction, the pressure or volume flow of a fluid

SimilarAnnotations.Name: shifting on-time
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: length of time that elapses between the control signal (electric or pneumatic) being applied and the pressure increasing at the respective valve output until 10 % of the defined operating pressure is reached

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Switch-on time
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: describes the time it takes for the sensor to be ready after the supply voltage is applied

DataFeatures.Name: Switching time on
DataFeatures.Definition: The time it takes for the valve to switch on.
DataFeatures.SourceDescription: The switching time on is mentioned in the input text.

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Valve switching times from 0 to 1
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: Time between the switch-on command and the control of a component which controls or regulates the direction, the pressure or volume flow of a fluid

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Valve switching times from 0 to 1
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: Time between the switch-on command and the control of a component which controls or regulates the direction, the pressure or volume flow of a fluid

SimilarAnnotations.Name: shifting on-time
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: length of time that elapses between the control signal (electric or pneumatic) being applied and the pressure increasing at the respective valve output until 10 % of the defined operating pressure is reached

SimilarAnnotations.Name: Switch-on time
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: describes the time it takes for the sensor to be ready after the supply voltage is applied

SimilarAnnotations.Name: shifting off-time
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: length of time that elapses between the control signal (electric or pneumatic) being withdrawn and the pressure decreasing at the respective valve output until 90 % of the defined operating pressure is reached

DataFeatures.Name: Duty cycle
DataFeatures.Definition: The percentage of time the valve is in operation.
DataFeatures.SourceDescription: The duty cycle is mentioned in the input text.

SimilarAnnotations.Name: working time (cycles)
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: number of shifting cycles to which a system, sub-system, component or piping was subjected, during operation of a function

SimilarAnnotations.Name: remaining working time (cycles)
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: remaining given number of switching cycles during which a system, subsystem, component or piping system is still to be subjected to a function taking into account the current operating time during operation

SimilarAnnotations.Name: duty cycle measurements possible
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: specification whether or whether not the multimeter can measure duty cycles

SimilarAnnotations.Name: specified maximum remaining working time (cycles)
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: remaining maximum number of shifting cycles to which a system, subsystem, component or piping shall be subjected during operation

SimilarAnnotations.Name: minimum set working time (cycles)
SimilarAnnotations.Definition: given minimum number of shifting cycles to which a system, sub-system, component or pipe system shall be subjected during operation
